data.title: 'make clean' doesn't remove OpenRA.exe from Windows builds
Stripped down the platform dependencies
data.body:
I added https://github.com/OpenRA/SDL2-CS but stripped it to only add what we need, so the unused SDL2_image.cs, SDL2_mixer.cs, SDL2_ttf.cs, AudioCapture.cs, but most importantly GL.cs and GLCore.cs have been reduced (~100x less methods) which I dubbed it MicroTK now. Inpired by https://github.com/flibitijibibo/SDL2-CS/issues/20#issuecomment-67949509.

The benefits are:
- 61 OpenGL extensions loaded instead of EVERYTHING
- 2,1 MB size reduction of our binary package
- easier packaging for distros that require to build completely from source

I also removed the OpenAL (and subsequent OpenTK) dependency from OpenRA.Game and placed it into the renderer DLLs, which in fact do a lot more than just rendering nowadays (input, window creation, etc.) so I renamed things to reflect this. This became a bigger job than I thought. Hope it was worth it.

data.title: Repair the GDI Base (b) does not play "Mission Accomplished" audio
data.body: May also affect other missions.

data.title: Do not fire script triggers while the world is being destroyed
data.body: Fixes #8526.

data.title: UI: single player missions should not have a button for beacon placement
data.body: there's nobody who can see the signal

data.title: Some missions are missing "Reinforcements have arrived" notification at the start
data.body: Noticed with "Repair the GDI Base (b)", but probably affects others too.

Visible in "Mao Civil War (a)".

data.title: "Mao Civil War (a)" initial camera position is incorrect
data.body: It is centered in the shroud, with the units entering the world being hidden behind the build palette at 1024 x 850 resolution.

data.title: Warthog hunt "Destroy the GDI base" objective is incorrect
data.body: You need to destroy everything in order to achieve this.  The wording should be changed to "Destroy all GDI forces", or the trigger changes to all buildings destroyed.

data.title: Use INotifyActorDisposing to dispose LuaScript as part of the world disposal.
data.body: Fixes #8526.

data.title: TD mission script fixes
data.body:
nod06 (a, b, c): transport helicopter no longer selectable

nod06c would crash if you moved to the extraction point without first picking up the crate
easiest way to reproduce is to edit the map to move to the extraction point immediately

edit: changes added to also fix #8537
edit: changes added to also fix #8534
edit: gdi05b: player's tanks would crush the sandbags in the abandoned GDI base because their owner was set to neutral - set all sbags to either gdi or nod
edit: nod04a: set initial camera position; fixes #8532
edit: fixed sbag owner in gdi04b and nod05 
edit: music now starts playing when a mission starts

is there a way to make the helicopter land in nod06? currently it moves to the flare, then stays there

data.title: Introduce new options for shroud visibility and revealing.
data.body:
This splits the `GetVisOrigins` query into different configurable options for shroud visibility and revealing.

`HiddenUnderShroud.Type = CenterPosition` will be used in TS to ensure that units are revealed correctly when they are on an odd-height tile (where the shroud tiles are staggered over position tiles, and units would otherwise be revealed if any of the 4 nearby tiles are revealed).  It does not change anything in the classic mods. 

`RevealsShroud.Type = CenterPosition` is used for units that should reveal in a circle around their center instead of from every cell in their footprint.  This is used for aircraft (which don't have any cells in their footprint), and can be used to replicate the original games' building shroud revealing behavior.

data.title: Crash in gdi04a and gdi04b ("Get the rods back") and nod04b ("Oum Hadjer")
data.body:
If you abort the mission, both "battle control terminated" and "mission accomplished" are played, then openra crashes

edit: all the other TD missions work

data.title: Remove "Enemy Unit Detected" announcements
data.body: By popular demand.  The `EnemyWatcher` removal is deferred to the next playtest.

data.title: Added a check for Visual Studio runtime at game start
data.body: Another attempt to solve https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8493.

data.title: GDI Upgrade center prerequisites are wrong
data.body: It is visible in the Nod build palette.

data.title: Deployed tick tanks are treated as regular base structures
data.body: They can be repaired, and play the "base under attack" notification when attacked.

data.title: Fixed a desync when creating a new map on a tileset that differs from the shellmap
data.body:
To reproduce:
- Settings - Advanced: Check Sync around unsynced code.
- Create a new SNOW map in the Tiberian Sun mod.

Fix was inspired by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8502.

data.title: Save maps with the correct MapClassification.
data.body: This fixes system maps being moved to the custom maps tab after you save them.

data.title: Fix screen bounds calculations
data.body: This fixes the screen bounds calculation (in diamond coords there is only _one_ height step per map row), drops the arbitrary padding factors that tried to work around that bug, and adds comments explaining each step.

data.title: Nod vehicles in TD campaign use wrong colours
data.body: Needs a new palette trait, hints from IRC are [here](http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=06&day=06#14:49:38) and [here](http://logs.openra.net/?year=2015&month=06&day=20#13:19:11).
